discussion.content: Correct. Conference phones and Teams displays do not support additional front of room displays.

questions.question_text:
You are selecting devices for use in conference rooms. The conference rooms must support two front of room displays.

Which two types of devices meet the requirements? Each correct answer presents a complete solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

You have a Teams Phone deployment.

When you review the Server - Client summary reports in Teams, you discover that Wired Inside data is unavailable as shown in the following exhibit.

//IMG//


You need to review the monthly and daily trends in the reports.

What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/cqd-upload-tenant-building-data#endpoint-data-file. Endpoint data file does not include details whether device is inside or outside, but tenant building information has it

Selected Answer: C
I think C is correct.

choices.A: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, configure the network topology.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard, upload the Endpoint data file.
choices.B: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, upload reporting labels.
choices.C: From the Microsoft Call Quality Dashboard, upload the Building data file.

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams deployment.

You have the users shown in the following table.

//IMG//


You need to identify which users meet the following requirements:

• Can assign watermarks to meetings.
• Can configure end-to-end meeting encryption.

Which users should you identify?

discussion.content:
Watermarks for meetings: Requires a Microsoft Teams Premium license.
End-to-End Meeting Encryption: Requires a Microsoft Teams Premium license.

Answer B is correct.

A is wrong since you need to have Premium license for using watermarks
C is wrong since this is a resource account
D and E are wrong, see above

choices.B: the call delay and order settings

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft Teams Phone deployment that contains two users named User1 and User2.
User1 will be on leave for two weeks.
You need to redirect all calls to the phone number of User1 to the phone number of User2. The solution must minimize administrative effort.
What should you modify for User1?

You have a Microsoft Teams deployment.

A user named User1 plans to host a live event.

You create a new meeting policy and set Screen sharing mode to Entire screen.

You need to complete the meeting policy configuration to ensure that User1 can host the live event.

Which two settings should you set to On? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

discussion.content:
correct B and E : 
Private meeting scheduling in Teams enabled (The TeamsMeetingPolicy -AllowPrivateMeetingScheduling parameter = True).
Video sharing enabled in Teams meetings (The TeamsMeetingPolicy -AllowIPVideo parameter = True).

I think that this question or answers are not correct since it mixes 2 type of things: The user wants to host a LIVE EVENT, so this means that the user MUST have a live events policy assigned, which I do not see here as an option.
